item.title: Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’ - News18
item.description:
Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai expressed his discontent with IndiGo's service after being left waiting on the tarmac in Bengaluru without air conditioning.

  • Passengers were left on the hot tarmac in Bengaluru, with the air conditioning reportedly non-operational.
  • Pai shared his experience on social media, prompting others to share similar complaints.
  • After a passenger protest, IndiGo staff used a generator to power the air conditioning.
  • Pai called on IndiGo to change their protocols to prevent future incidents.
  • IndiGo responded to his post, assuring that customer comfort is a priority and that they value feedback.
“Indigo treats its passengers badly. Sitting in 6E 7407 without AC on hot tarmac in Bengaluru. No way to treat passengers. Only after protest staff using tarmac generator for AC...” — Mohandas Pai

This incident highlights ongoing issues with passenger treatment in airlines and brings attention to the need for better customer service practices.

item.description:
SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

SBI Life has announced its decision to acquire a 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation for ₹6.6 crore, aiming to enhance the insurance product marketplace.

  • SBI Life's board approved an investment not exceeding 10% of Bima Sugam's paid-up equity share capital.
  • Bima Sugam India Federation is set to create a centralized marketplace for insurance products and services.
  • The company will invest ₹6.6 crore to purchase 66 lakh equity shares at a face value of ₹10 each.

item.title: JSW Energy Jumps 8% Amid O2 Power Acquisition; Motilal Oswal Shares Target Price - News18
item.description:
JSW Energy Shares Rise 8% Following O2 Power Acquisition Announcement

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

JSW Energy's stock surged by 8% after the announcement of its acquisition of O2 Power, a renewable energy platform, reflecting strong investor confidence.

  • JSW Energy’s subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, will acquire O2 Power, valued at Rs 12,468 crore ($1.47 billion).
  • The deal includes acquiring O2 Power Midco Holdings and O2 Energy SG, pending regulatory approval.
  • Post-announcement, shares of JSW Energy reached Rs 673.05, marking a 7.67% increase.
  • Motilal Oswal has set a target price of Rs 810 per share for JSW Energy.
  • The stock has seen a 67% increase from its 52-week low, although it's down 17% from its high.
“Motilal Oswal Financial Services has a favorable outlook on JSW Energy, indicating strong operational performance.”

The increase in JSW Energy's shares indicates positive market sentiment regarding its expansion into renewable energy, showcasing the potential for future growth.

item.title: 'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on deprecia - The Times of India
item.description:
'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on depreciating currency during UPA government

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Congress has referenced past remarks made by Prime Minister Modi regarding the depreciation of the Indian Rupee, contrasting them with the current exchange rate of 85.27 against the dollar.

  • The Rupee was valued at 58.58 against the dollar in 2014.
  • Current statistics show a significant depreciation with the Rupee now at 85.27.
  • Congress has criticized the government's handling of the economy.
“In 2013, Modi warned against the falling currency, but now his government is facing the same issue.”

The ongoing depreciation of the Rupee raises concerns regarding the economic policies of the current administration and its implications for ordinary citizens.

item.title: ITC Hotels Listing Date: 'Within 60 days from...' - Big update from ITC ahead of demerger record date - ET Now
item.description:
ITC Hotels Listing Date Update

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: ET Now

ITC Limited has officially announced the listing date for ITC Hotels shares, in light of its upcoming demerger. The shares are expected to debut on the NSE and BSE by February 16, 2025.

  • ITC has confirmed an update on the listing date of ITC Hotels shares.
  • As part of the demerger scheme, shareholders will receive 1 share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held.
  • 20% of ITC Hotels' inventory is under 5 years old, operating at 75% occupancy levels.
“ITC and ITC Hotels mutually acknowledged that all conditions specified in Clause 28 of the Scheme have been satisfied.”

To qualify for the new shares, ITC shareholders must be on record as of January 6, 2025.

item.title: Stocks decline as yields remain elevated - Reuters
item.description:
Stocks Decline as Yields Remain Elevated

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, Reuters

Introduction: Global stocks fell for a third straight session on Monday, with Wall Street tumbling, as recent elevated U.S. Treasury yields prompted profit taking at the end of a strong year for equities.

  1. U.S., European stocks fall
  2. Dollar up broadly but weaker vs yen
  3. 10-year U.S. Treasury yield falls but holds above 4.5%
The benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yield's recent push above the 4.5% mark... will be a strong headwind for equity prices.

Conclusion: Stock markets in several countries were closed or had abbreviated trading sessions ahead of the New Year holiday.

item.title: ‘Boss Called Me A**hole’: Intern, 21, Opens Up About Toxic Workplace In India - News18
item.description:
Intern Reveals Toxic Work Environment After Being Insulted by Boss in India

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: News18

A 21-year-old intern shared his distressing experience of workplace bullying on Reddit, revealing how his boss verbally assaulted him over a minor mistake in his work.

  • The intern was called an “a**hole” by his boss over a simple error in a draft.
  • He expressed his concerns on Reddit, seeking advice on whether to report the issue.
  • This incident highlights the toxic work culture present in some corporate environments in India.
  • The intern worried about possible repercussions of escalating the issue.
  • Reddit users encouraged him to address the situation and not remain silent.
“To say I was shocked would be an understatement. I’m genuinely frustrated and this isn’t the first time.”

This unfortunate incident raises awareness about bullying and the need for healthier workplace environments.

item.title: Gold prices dip as markets await fresh catalysts - Reuters
item.description:
Gold Prices Dip as Markets Await Fresh Catalysts

Publication Date: Dec 30

Source: Reuters

Gold prices dipped as traders awaited fresh catalysts, including upcoming U.S. economic data that could influence the Federal Reserve's interest-rate outlook and policies from incoming President Trump.

  • Gold has gained nearly 27% this year.
  • U.S. jobs data and December Fed meeting minutes are expected next week.
  • Platinum hit over a three-month low on Friday.
“I think it's just the holiday thin trade. Perhaps some squaring of the books before year-end,” said Peter Grant, vice president and senior metals strategist at Zaner Metals.

Geopolitical tensions are expected to remain high, with central banks continuing to buy gold, as the U.S. debt situation worsens, fueling ongoing safe-haven demand.

item.title: Private Banks Grapple With 25% Attrition Rate, Operational Risks Loom: RBI - News18
item.description:
Private Banks Face 25% Employee Attrition Amid Operational Risks, Says RBI

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

The Reserve Bank of India's latest report highlights a troubling rise in employee attrition rates within private sector banks, which have reached approximately 25%. This poses serious operational risks for these financial institutions.

  • Employee attrition in private banks has increased to about 25%.
  • This trend brings significant operational risks related to customer service and loss of institutional knowledge.
  • The report indicates that the total count of employees in private banks has eclipsed that of public sector banks.
  • Strategies recommended to reduce turnover include better onboarding, career development, and supportive workplace cultures.
  • The RBI urged banks to review their gold loan policies due to observed irregularities.
  • Climate change risks are projected to negatively influence the financial stability of institutions.
“High attrition and employee turnover rate pose significant operational risks, including disruption in customer services, besides leading to loss of institutional knowledge and increased recruitment costs.” - RBI Report

This rising attrition rate signifies a critical challenge for private banks that requires immediate and effective strategic responses to safeguard operational efficiency and ensure long-term stability.

item.title: RBI warns against spillover of unsecured loan stress | Mint - Mint
item.description:
RBI warns against spillover of unsecured loan stress

Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India has raised alarms regarding the stress from unsecured loans potentially affecting larger secured loans, as many borrowers of small, collateral-free loans also hold housing and auto loans.

  • The concern originates from the fact that defaulting on unsecured loans could turn larger loans non-performing as well.
  • Approximately half of those taking personal and credit card loans also have high-ticket loans like housing or vehicle loans.
  • The bad loan ratio for unsecured loans is higher than that for secured loans, with 1.7% reported as of September 30.
  • 11% of borrowers taking personal loans under ₹50,000 had overdue personal loans, and over 60% had taken more than three loans this fiscal year.
"Signs of stress have also started to appear in small loans," said the RBI.

Despite the challenges, lenders are reportedly exercising prudence, noting a slight decrease in below-prime customer shares.

item.title: 3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them? - News18
item.description:
3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them?

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

Starting January 1, 2025, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will implement rule changes affecting numerous bank accounts across the country. It is crucial for customers to understand these changes and how they may impact their accounts.

  • Dormant accounts (inactive for over two years) will be closed.
  • Inactive accounts (no transaction for 12 months or more) will also face closure.
  • Zero balance accounts maintained for an extended period risk being closed.
“To safeguard customers and the banking system, the RBI has decided to close such accounts.”

Customers must take immediate action to reactivate dormant accounts by completing necessary KYC processes.
